review_title: Excellent employees achieving amazing impact in the community
job_title: HR Generalist in Albuquerque, NM
pros: I came to Southwest Care Center hoping that the organization would be even half as good as the person who recruited me described. It is at least twice as good. Caring staff saving lives _ how could you not get out of bed excited to be part of that?!?
cons: There's always one in the crowd, they need to be encouraged to find another calling and get out of the rest of our way.

review_title: Things may have improved but learn from mistakes
job_title: Community Outreach Coordinator in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Decent salary, work with other people passionate about health care and disparities
cons: Upper management and admin at the time was corrupt

job_title: HIM Specialist in Santa Fe, NM
pros: good pay compared to other companies
cons: I had to commute everyday

job_title: Administrative in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Amazing people and benefits. Non-judgmental healthcare and work environment.
cons: Small organization so there are limited opportunities to move up in many positions. It is also an organization that had to dig deep to transition. It creates continuous change but the org is headed in the right direction and has created stability for the past 2 years which means patients and employees alike will benefit.

job_title: Case Manager in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Good benefits, supportive staff and coworkers
cons: Difficult clients, mentally draining work, high turnover

job_title: Front Desk Agent in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Pay and benefits are competitive
cons: Poor admin, management, unethical HR

review_title: Rewarding and fun place to work!
job_title: Medical Case Manager in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Everyone that works at Southwest Care Center truly has a passion for delivering the best care to their patients. Everyone is accepted regardless of age, race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or beliefs. I feel like Southwest Care Center is my second home and family. It is such a fun place to be with great energy and the work is so rewarding!
cons: I can't think of anything negative to say about Southwest Care!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Good people, good benefits, Nice to feel like your helping people the work is good and interesting and I have learned a lot while working there
cons: The pay could be a more competitive. There is favoritism with management and not a lot of chances for advancement

job_title: Senior Manager in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Excellent place to work for someone who enjoys working in a team environment where creativity and innovation are appreciated and valued. Our organization is constantly working to improve patient outcomes. Salaries are very competitive for the area.
cons: The Pros outweigh the Cons that come with every career. Definitely a place that I would recommend to job seekers.

review_title: Avoid if at all possible, especially if you’re a POC
job_title: Prevention, Linkage to Care and Diagnostic Manager in Santa Fe, NM
pros: The pay is mostly fair.
cons:
Corrupt. Wasteful.
 Out of touch with the community the serve. 
Leadership is most if not all hired from out of state. 
Closet bigots. Contract Breachers
 EEOC investigation magnets and lawsuits.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Fe, NM
pros: We have a mission to provide excellent care to populations generally disadvantaged when it comes to healthcare - we are needed in our communities.  SCC Provides solid benefits to employees including reimbursement for up to $20 a month for gym membership, health/fitness classes etc. to encourage wellness.  Co-workers are awesome.  There is a culture of respect, support, and professionalism.
cons: We could use commuter vans for people who live in outlying areas but work in Santa Fe or Albuquerque.  Or live in Santa Fe but work in Albuquerque and vice versa.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Santa Fe, NM
pros: I'm super proud to say I am an employee at Southwest Care. The environment is so positive and everyone is so passionate, eager and willing to go above and beyond for our patients!
cons: There are no cons at this time :)

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Albuquerque, NM
pros: It was an okay place to work
cons: Upper management was in shambles and growing at a rate that is beyond the realm of the organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Welcoming environment ,Great people at all levels of the company ,Excellent Benefits
cons: N/A  N/A N/A N/A N/A
